creditline: Gift of Gabriel P. and Yvonne M.L. Weisberg for the Weisberg Collection of European Drawings and Prints of the Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Centuries
description: cat. 17; two standing men, one holding walking stick two men stand at confrontation and anticipation; large trees at R; blue paper; white mat; thin gold frame with ridges and red undertones
medium: Black, red, and white chalk on blue paper
text: Philippe-Auguste Jeanron was intensely interested in depicting the various social types in the French population. The Meeting shows two men from Jeanron's native region of Limousin, in central France, wearing their traditional costume of baggy pants, wide-brimmed hat, and leather boots drawn up to the knee. It prefigures the midcentury realist approach of seizing on images of ordinary life as a way to create art accessible to all.
title: The Meeting
